Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one from land and one from water.
The student can include different types of plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, fish, and clams.
The student can show how plants and animals are organized within each habitat.
The student can make comparisons by drawing different types of living things present in each habitat.
The student can explain through their drawing how these observations show patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
